001package io.github.ai4ci.abm;
002
003import java.io.Serializable;
004import java.util.Arrays;
005import java.util.Optional;
006
007import org.immutables.value.Value;
008
009import io.github.ai4ci.config.ImmutableTestParameters;
010import io.github.ai4ci.config.TestParameters;
011import io.github.ai4ci.config.execution.ExecutionConfiguration;
012import io.github.ai4ci.util.Sampler;
013import io.github.ai4ci.util.ShallowList;
014
015/**
016 * Models a testing process and its outcome for an individual in the simulation.
017 * This immutable value object captures the details of a single test event,
018 * including the true viral load at the time of testing, the type of test
019 * administered, and the observed result after accounting for test parameters
020 * like sensitivity, specificity, and delay. Instances of this class are
021 * typically generated by the simulation engine when a {@link Person} undergoes
022 * testing. This class is {@link Serializable} for persistence across simulation
023 * runs.
024 */
025@Value.Immutable
026public interface TestResult extends Serializable {
027
028        /**
029         * Defines the indication for which a test was performed.
030         * <ul>
031         * <li>{@code REACTIVE}: The test was performed in response to symptoms or
032         * known exposure.</li>
033         * <li>{@code SCREENING}: The test was performed as part of a routine
034         * screening program, without specific symptoms or known exposure.</li>
035         * </ul>
036         */
037        public static enum Indication {
038                /** The test was performed in response to symptoms or known exposure. */
039                REACTIVE,
040                /**
041                 * The test was performed as part of a routine screening program, without
042                 * specific symptoms or known exposure.
043                 */
044                SCREENING
045        }
046
047        /**
048         * Represents the possible outcomes of a test.
049         * <ul>
050         * <li>{@code PENDING}: The test has been taken but the result is not yet
051         * available due to processing delay.</li>
052         * <li>{@code POSITIVE}: The test result indicates the presence of the
053         * pathogen.</li>
054         * <li>{@code NEGATIVE}: The test result indicates the absence of the
055         * pathogen.</li>
056         * </ul>
057         */
058        public enum Result {
059                /**
060                 * The test has been taken but the result is not yet available due to
061                 * processing delay.
062                 */
063                PENDING,
064                /** The test result indicates the presence of the pathogen. */
065                POSITIVE,
066                /** The test result indicates the absence of the pathogen. */
067                NEGATIVE
068        }
069
070        /**
071         * Defines the types of tests available in the simulation, each with its
072         * specific parameters. These parameters, such as sensitivity, specificity,
073         * and test delay, are crucial for accurately modeling the diagnostic
074         * performance and logistical aspects of each test type. The viral load
075         * normalization described below is critical for interpreting these
076         * parameters.
077         */
078        public static enum Type {
079                /**
080                 * A rapid antigen test with high sensitivity and specificity, and no
081                 * delay.
082                 */
083                LFT(
084                                ImmutableTestParameters.builder().setSensitivity(0.9)
085                                                .setSpecificity(0.98).setMeanTestDelay(0.0)
086                                                .setSdTestDelay(0.0).setLimitOfDetection(1D)
087                ),
088                /**
089                 * A PCR test with slightly lower sensitivity but very high specificity,
090                 * and a delay of a few days.
091                 */
092                PCR(
093                                ImmutableTestParameters.builder().setSensitivity(0.8)
094                                                .setSpecificity(0.995).setMeanTestDelay(3.0)
095                                                .setSdTestDelay(1.0).setLimitOfDetection(0.1)
096                );
097
098                private TestParameters params;
099
100                private Type(ImmutableTestParameters.Builder params) {
101                        this.params = params.setTestName(this.name()).build();
102                }
103
104                /**
105                 * Provides a builder initialized with the parameters of this test type,
106                 * allowing for modification.
107                 *
108                 * @return An {@link ImmutableTestParameters.Builder} pre-filled with this
109                 *         type's parameters.
110                 */
111                public ImmutableTestParameters.Builder modify() {
112                        return ImmutableTestParameters.builder().from(this.params);
113                }
114
115                /**
116                 * Returns the {@link TestParameters} associated with this test type.
117                 *
118                 * @return The parameters defining the characteristics of this test type.
119                 */
120                public TestParameters params() {
121                        return this.params;
122                }
123
124        }
125
126        private static TestResult build(
127                        double viralLoad, long time, TestParameters testParams,
128                        Indication indication
129        ) {
130                return ImmutableTestResult.builder().setViralLoadTruth(viralLoad)
131                                .setTestParams(testParams).setIndication(indication).setTime(time)
132                                .build();
133        }
134
135        /**
136         * **Viral Load Normalization and Test Logic:** The viral load in the
137         * simulation is normalized such that a value of 1 represents a baseline
138         * infectious state that a perfectly sensitive and specific test
139         * {@code should} detect. This normalization is crucial for defining test
140         * sensitivity and specificity in a consistent manner.
141         *
142         * **Sensitivity and Specificity:** Test parameters ({@link TestParameters})
143         * define sensitivity and specificity. These are interpreted as follows:
144         * <ul>
145         * <li>**Sensitivity:** The probability that a test correctly identifies an
146         * infected individual (i.e., a true positive). In the model, this relates to
147         * the probability of detecting a viral load above the
148         * {@link TestParameters#getLimitOfDetection() limit of detection} given the
149         * true viral load is indicative of infection.</li>
150         * <li>**Specificity:** The probability that a test correctly identifies a
151         * non-infected individual (i.e., a true negative). This relates to the
152         * probability of a test returning negative when the true viral load is below
153         * the infectious threshold.</li>
154         * </ul>
155         * The {@link TestParameters#applyNoise(double, Sampler)} method is used to
156         * simulate the observed viral load sample, incorporating the inherent noise
157         * and limitations of the test, which in turn determines the
158         * {@link #getFinalObservedResult() final observed result}. The
159         * {@link TestParameters#getLimitOfDetection()} acts as the cutoff for
160         * determining a positive or negative observed result.
161         */
162
163        /**
164         * Provides a {@link ShallowList} of default {@link TestParameters} for all
165         * defined {@link Type}s. This is useful for initializing the set of
166         * available tests in the simulation configuration.
167         *
168         * @return A {@link ShallowList} containing the default parameters for each
169         *         test type.
170         */
171        static ShallowList<TestParameters> defaultTypes() {
172                var tmp = new ShallowList<TestParameters>();
173                Arrays.asList(Type.values()).stream().map(t -> t.params())
174                                .forEach(tmp::add);
175                return tmp;
176        }
177
178        private static Optional<TestResult> resultFrom(
179                        ExecutionConfiguration cfg, double viralLoad, int time, String type,
180                        Indication indication
181        ) {
182
183                return cfg.getAvailableTests().stream()
184                                .filter(tp -> tp.getTestName().equalsIgnoreCase(type)).findFirst()
185                                .map(params -> {
186                                        return TestResult.build(
187                                                        viralLoad, // true test status as test is testing
188                                                                                        // infectiousness
189                                                        time, // test date
190                                                        params, indication
191                                        );
192                                });
193        }
194
195        /**
196         * Creates an {@link Optional} {@link TestResult} for a given
197         * {@link PersonTemporalState} and {@link Type}. This factory method is used
198         * by the simulation to generate new test results. It retrieves the
199         * {@link ExecutionConfiguration} from the person's {@link Outbreak}, uses
200         * the person's {@link PersonTemporalState#getNormalisedViralLoad() current
201         * viral load} and {@link PersonTemporalState#getTime() current time}, and
202         * the specified {@link Type} to build a new {@link TestResult} with a
203         * {@link Indication#REACTIVE} indication.
204         *
205         * @param testee The {@link PersonTemporalState} of the individual being
206         *               tested.
207         * @param type   The {@link Type} of test to be performed.
208         * @return An {@link Optional} containing the new {@link TestResult}, or
209         *         empty if the test type is not found.
210         */
211        public static Optional<TestResult> resultFrom(
212                        PersonTemporalState testee, Type type
213        ) {
214                return resultFrom(
215                                testee.getEntity().getOutbreak().getExecutionConfiguration(),
216                                testee.getNormalisedViralLoad(), testee.getTime(), type.name(),
217                                Indication.REACTIVE
218                );
219        }
220
221        /**
222         * Creates an {@link Optional} {@link TestResult} for a screening test,
223         * similar to {@link #resultFrom(PersonTemporalState, Type)}. This method
224         * specifically sets the {@link Indication} to {@link Indication#SCREENING}.
225         *
226         * @param testee The {@link PersonTemporalState} of the individual being
227         *               screened.
228         * @param type   The {@link Type} of screening test to be performed.
229         * @return An {@link Optional} containing the new screening
230         *         {@link TestResult}, or empty if the test type is not found.
231         */
232        static Optional<TestResult> screeningResultFrom(
233                        PersonTemporalState testee, Type type
234        ) {
235                return resultFrom(
236                                testee.getEntity().getOutbreak().getExecutionConfiguration(),
237                                testee.getNormalisedViralLoad(), testee.getTime(), type.name(),
238                                Indication.SCREENING
239                );
240        }
241
242        /**
243         * Calculates the delay in days until the test result is available. This
244         * delay is sampled from a log-normal distribution using the mean and
245         * standard deviation specified in {@link TestParameters#getMeanTestDelay()}
246         * and {@link TestParameters#getSdTestDelay()}. A {@link Sampler} is used to
247         * introduce stochasticity in the delay.
248         *
249         * @return The test delay in days as a long.
250         */
251        @Value.Derived
252        public default long getDelay() {
253                var rng = Sampler.getSampler();
254                return Math.round(
255                                rng.logNormal(
256                                                this.getTestParams().getMeanTestDelay(),
257                                                this.getTestParams().getSdTestDelay()
258                                )
259                );
260        }
261
262        /**
263         * Determines the final observed result of the test based on the
264         * {@link #getViralLoadSample() sampled viral load} and the
265         * {@link TestParameters#getLimitOfDetection() test's limit of detection}. If
266         * the sampled viral load is greater than the limit of detection, the result
267         * is considered positive.
268         *
269         * @return {@code true} if the final observed result is positive,
270         *         {@code false} otherwise.
271         */
272        @Value.Derived
273        default public boolean getFinalObservedResult() {
274                return (this.getViralLoadSample() > this.getTestParams()
275                                .getLimitOfDetection());
276        }
277
278        /**
279         * Returns the final {@link Result} of the test (either
280         * {@link Result#POSITIVE} or {@link Result#NEGATIVE}). This is directly
281         * derived from {@link #getFinalObservedResult()}.
282         *
283         * @return The final {@link Result} of the test.
284         */
285        default public Result getFinalResult() {
286                if (this.getFinalObservedResult()) { return Result.POSITIVE; }
287                return Result.NEGATIVE;
288        }
289
290        /**
291         * Returns the {@link Indication} for which this test was performed (e.g.,
292         * REACTIVE or SCREENING).
293         *
294         * @return The {@link Indication} of the test.
295         */
296        public Indication getIndication();
297
298        /**
299         * Calculates the estimated time (day) when the test result will become
300         * available. This is determined by adding the {@link #getDelay() test delay}
301         * to the {@link #getTime() sampling time}.
302         *
303         * @return The estimated result availability time as a long.
304         */
305        default long getResultTime() { return this.getTime() + this.getDelay(); }
306
307        /**
308         * Returns the {@link TestParameters} that define the characteristics of this
309         * specific test. These parameters include sensitivity, specificity, and
310         * delay, which influence the observed test result.
311         *
312         * @return The {@link TestParameters} for this test.
313         */
314        public TestParameters getTestParams();
315
316        /**
317         * Returns the simulation time (day) when the test was sampled.
318         *
319         * @return The time of test sampling as a long.
320         */
321        public long getTime();
322
323//      default public boolean confirmedPositive(int day) {
324//              return (resultOnDay(day) == Result.POSITIVE);
325//      }
326//
327//      default public boolean confirmedNegative(int day) {
328//              return (resultOnDay(day) == Result.NEGATIVE);
329//      }
330
331//      @Value.Derived default public Result getTrueResult() {
332//              if (getViralLoadTruth() > 1) return Result.POSITIVE;
333//              return Result.NEGATIVE;
334//      }
335
336        /**
337         * Calculates and returns the observed viral load sample, which incorporates
338         * noise based on the test's characteristics. This value is derived from
339         * {@link #getViralLoadTruth()} by applying a noise model defined in
340         * {@link TestParameters#applyNoise(double, Sampler)}. The noise simulates
341         * the variability and imperfections of real-world testing.
342         *
343         * @return The sampled viral load as a double.
344         */
345        @Value.Derived
346        public default double getViralLoadSample() {
347                var rng = Sampler.getSampler();
348                return this.getTestParams().applyNoise(this.getViralLoadTruth(), rng);
349        }
350
351        /**
352         * Returns the true viral load of the person at the time the test was
353         * sampled. This value represents the actual biological state, independent of
354         * test performance.
355         *
356         * @return The true viral load as a double.
357         */
358        public double getViralLoadTruth();
359
360//      // what is the probability given a particular result that the person
361//      // has disease?
362//      // If the disease is uncommon the positive test is still less likely
363//      // to be due to disease.
364//      default double postTestProbPositive(int day, double prevalence) {
365//              if (resultOnDay(day).equals(Result.POSITIVE)) {
366//                      return this.getTestParams().postPositiveTestProbability(prevalence);
367//              } else if (resultOnDay(day).equals(Result.NEGATIVE)) {
368//                      return this.getTestParams().postNegativeTestProbability(prevalence);
369//              } else {
370//                      return prevalence;
371//              }
372//      }
373//
374//      default double postTestProbNegative(int day, double prevalence) {
375//              return 1-postTestProbPositive(day, prevalence);
376//      }
377
378        /**
379         * Checks if the test result is available by the specified {@code day}. This
380         * is true if the {@code day} is greater than or equal to the
381         * {@link #getResultTime() result availability time}.
382         *
383         * @param day The current simulation day to check against.
384         * @return {@code true} if the result is available by this day, {@code false}
385         *         otherwise.
386         */
387        default public boolean isResultAvailable(int day) {
388                return day >= this.getTime() + this.getDelay();
389        }
390
391        /**
392         * Checks if the test result is considered current on a given {@code day}
393         * within a {@code recoveryTime} window. A result is current if the
394         * {@code day} is on or after the {@link #getTime() test sampling time} and
395         * before {@code getTime() + recoveryTime}.
396         *
397         * @param day          The current simulation day.
398         * @param recoveryTime The duration for which the test result remains
399         *                     relevant.
400         * @return {@code true} if the result is current, {@code false} otherwise.
401         */
402        default public boolean isResultCurrent(long day, long recoveryTime) {
403                return day >= this.getTime() && day < this.getTime() + recoveryTime;
404        }
405
406        /**
407         * Checks if the test result becomes available on the specified {@code day}.
408         * This is true if the {@code day} matches the {@link #getResultTime() result
409         * availability time}.
410         *
411         * @param day The current simulation day to check against.
412         * @return {@code true} if the result is available today, {@code false}
413         *         otherwise.
414         */
415        default public boolean isResultToday(int day) {
416                return day == this.getTime() + this.getDelay();
417        }
418
419        /**
420         * The log likelihood ratio {@code delay} days after the test was taken. If
421         * the actual {@link #getDelay() test delay} is greater than the provided
422         * {@code delay}, a value of 0 is returned, meaning the result is not yet
423         * available at that point. Otherwise, {@link #trueLogLikelihoodRatio()} is
424         * returned.
425         *
426         * @param delay The number of days after the test was taken.
427         * @return The log-likelihood ratio at the specified delay.
428         */
429        default double logLikelihoodRatio(int delay) {
430                if (this.getDelay() > delay) { return 0; }
431                return this.trueLogLikelihoodRatio();
432        }
433
434//      default public Optional<Result> publishedResult(int day) {
435//              if (day != getTime()+getDelay()) return Optional.empty();
436//              return Optional.of(this.resultOnDay(day));
437//      }
438
439        /**
440         * Returns the log-likelihood ratio for the test result, considering its
441         * relevance within a specified time window. If the result is considered
442         * current (i.e., {@link #isResultCurrent(long, long)} returns true for the
443         * given day and recovery time), then {@link #trueLogLikelihoodRatio()} is
444         * returned. Otherwise, a value of 0 is returned, indicating no current
445         * evidential impact.
446         *
447         * @param day   The current simulation day.
448         * @param limit The recovery time or duration for which the test result
449         *              remains current.
450         * @return The log-likelihood ratio for the specified day and limit.
451         */
452        default double logLikelihoodRatio(int day, int limit) {
453                if (this.isResultCurrent(day, limit)) {
454                        return this.trueLogLikelihoodRatio();
455                }
456                return 0;
457        }
458
459        /**
460         * Returns the {@link Result} of the test on a given {@code day}. If the
461         * result is not yet available ({@link #isResultAvailable(int)} is false), it
462         * returns {@link Result#PENDING}. Otherwise, it returns
463         * {@link Result#POSITIVE} or {@link Result#NEGATIVE} based on
464         * {@link #getFinalObservedResult()}.
465         *
466         * @param day The current simulation day.
467         * @return The {@link Result} of the test for the specified day.
468         */
469        default public Result resultOnDay(int day) {
470                if (!this.isResultAvailable(day)) { return Result.PENDING; }
471                if (this.getFinalObservedResult()) { return Result.POSITIVE; }
472                return Result.NEGATIVE;
473        }
474
475        /**
476         * Calculates the true log-likelihood ratio for this test result. This ratio
477         * quantifies the change in the odds of infection given the observed test
478         * result. It is calculated based on whether the
479         * {@link #getFinalObservedResult() final observed result} is positive or
480         * negative, using {@link TestParameters#positiveLikelihoodRatio()} or
481         * {@link TestParameters#negativeLikelihoodRatio()}.
482         *
483         * @return The true log-likelihood ratio as a double.
484         */
485        @Value.Derived
486        default double trueLogLikelihoodRatio() {
487                return this.getFinalObservedResult()
488                                ? Math.log(this.getTestParams().positiveLikelihoodRatio())
489                                : Math.log(this.getTestParams().negativeLikelihoodRatio());
490        }
491
492}
